Directions.1: Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onions, scallions, and bell pepper. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are translucent, 10 to 15 minutes.

Directions.2: Add ground beef, oregano, salt, cayenne pepper, and cumin to the pot. Cook and stir beef until no longer pink, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly, then cover and place in the refrigerator until meat is completely cooled, about 1 hour.

Directions.3: Remove filling from the refrigerator and transfer to a colander to drain. Return filling to the Dutch oven.

Directions.4: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Liberally grease a baking sheet with butter.

Directions.5: Place about 2 tablespoons filling into the center of empanada disk. Fold empanada in half into a crescent shape, press the edges of dough together with a fork or your fingers to seal, and place onto the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining empanadas and filling. Brush tops with egg white.

Directions.6: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes.
